ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check Avahi Responses' to TTL Field
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check that Avahi is ignoring packets unless the TTL field is 255.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable Avahi from publishing records.

ns0:criteria.comment: Disable Avahi Publishing

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require Avahi to run on IPv4 or IPv6.

Test that Avahi IPv6 is enabled
Test that Avahi IPv4 and IPv6 are enabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Prevent Other Programs from using Avahi's Port
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensures that only Avahi is responsible for mDNS traffic coming from the port on the system.

ns0:criteria.comment: Prevent Avahi Port Sharing

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Information Published by Avahi
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Prevent user applications from using Avahi to publish services.

ns0:criteria.comment: Restrict Avahi Publishing
Test that Avahi publishing information is disabled

ns0:criterion.comment: Avahi user publishing information is disabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for argument audit=1 in the kernel line in /etc/grub.conf.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Kernel Support for USB via Bootloader Configuration
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for argument "nousb" in the kernel line in /etc/grub.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password retry Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password retry should meet minimum requirements

Minimize DHCP client configured options

Check domain-name-servers in each dhclient .conf files
Check nis-domain in each dhclient .conf files
Check nis-servers in each dhclient .conf files
Check ntp-servers in each dhclient .conf files
Check routers in each dhclient .conf files

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure rsyslog to record DHCP daemon errors.

ns0:criteria.comment: DHCP is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Prevents the DHCP from responding to BOOTP requests.

ns0:criteria.comment: DHCP is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Deny Decline Messages
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Prevents the DHCP from responding to the DHCPDECLINE messages.

ns0:criteria.comment: DHCP is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Dynamic DNS
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Prevents DHCP from publishing information about their clients using Dynamic DNS.

ns0:criteria.comment: DHCP is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Minimize Served DHCP Information
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Limits the amount of information that that the DHCP server provides to clients.

ns0:criteria.comment: DHCP is not being used or conditions are met
Minimize DHCP served info

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Interactive Boot
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The ability for users to perform interactive startups should be disabled.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check the value of PROMPT option in /etc/sysconfig/init. Fail if other than 'no'.
Check the presence of 'confirm' kernel boot argument in /etc/grub.conf. Fail if found.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable SELinux in /etc/grub.conf
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if selinux=0 OR enforcing=0 within /etc/grub.conf lines, fail if found.

ns0:criterion.comment: check value selinux|enforcing=0 in /etc/grub.conf, fail if found

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: File grub.conf Owned By root Group
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The grub.conf file should be owned by the root group. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub/grub.conf or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Find setuid files from system packages
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All files with setuid should be owned by a base system package

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure the FTP connection tracking module in iptables.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable FTP Uploads
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable FTP Uploads.

FTP configuration conditions are not set or are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Anonymous Users
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable anonymous access to FTP.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the User List
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GUI listing of all known users on the login screen.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable GUI Warning Banner
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable the GUI warning banner.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set GUI Warning Banner Text
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The text to be displayed in the GUI warning banner should be set correctly.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable GNOME Automounting
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system's default desktop environment, GNOME, will mount devices and removable media (such as DVDs, CDs and USB flash drives) whenever they are inserted into the system. Disable automount and autorun within GNOME.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the GNOME Clock Temperature Feature
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The GNOME clock temperature feature should be disabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the GNOME Clock Weather Feature
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The GNOME clock weather feature should be disabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Ctrl-Alt-Del Reboot Key Sequence in GNOME
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The Ctrl-Alt-Del reboot key sequence should be set to nothing.

ns0:criterion.comment: set Ctrl-Alt-Del key sequence to nothing
set Ctrl-Alt-Del key sequence to nothing

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the GNOME Login Restart and Shutdown Buttons
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME Login restart and shutdown buttons to prevent users from restarting or powering off the system from the login screen.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable All GNOME Thumbnailers
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system's default desktop environment, GNOME, uses a number of different thumbnailer programs to generate thumbnails for any new or modified content in an opened folder. Disable the execution of these thumbnail applications within GNOME.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: >Disable WIFI Network Connection Creation in GNOME
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME's ability to create a wifi connection.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable WIFI Network Disconnect Notification in GNOME
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME's ability to notify users when disconnecting from a wifi network.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable WIFI Network Connection Notification in GNOME
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME's ability to notify users when connecting to a wifi network.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set GNOME Screen Locking Keybindings
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: GNOME Screen Locking Keybindings should be configured to lock the screen on entry.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Implement idle activation of screen saver
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Idle activation of the screen saver should be enabled.

ns0:criterion.comment: gnome screensaver is activated on idle
gnome screensaver is activated on idle

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The allowed period of inactivity before the screensaver is activated.

ns0:criterion.comment: check value of idle_delay in GCONF
check value of idle_delay in GCONF

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Implement idle activation of screen lock
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set GNOME Login Maximum Allowed Inactivity Action
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Idle GNOME users should be logged off after a defined period of time.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set GNOME Login Maximum Allowed Inactivity
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The allowed period of inactivity before a user is logged off the system.

ns0:criterion.comment: check value of max_idle_time in GCONF
check value of max_idle_time in GCONF

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The screen saver should be blank.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable FIPS Mode in GRUB
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for argument fips=1 in the kernel line in /etc/grub.conf.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The add_random sysfs variable should be set correctly for each SSD drive on the system.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Printer Browsing Entirely if Possible
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The CUPS print service can be configured to broadcast a list of available printers to the network. Other machines on the network, also running the CUPS print service, can be configured to listen to these broadcasts and add and configure these printers for immediate use. By disabling this browsing capability, the machine will no longer generate or receive such broadcasts.

ns0:criterion.comment: Ensure remote printer browsing is off
Ensure no incoming printer information packets are allowed

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Printer Server if Possible
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: By default, locally configured printers will not be shared over the network, but if this functionality has somehow been enabled, these recommendations will disable it again. Be sure to disable outgoing printer list broadcasts, or remote users will still be able to see the locally configured printers, even if they cannot actually print to them. To limit print serving to a particular set of users, use the Policy directive.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a machine
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it doesn't then we consider to be host filesystem or virtual machine.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure LDAP to Use TLS for All Transactions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require the use of TLS for ldap clients.

ns0:criteria.comment: package pam_ldap is not present

ns0:extend_definition.comment: pam_ldap not present or not in use

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure LDAP CA Certificate Path
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require the use of TLS for ldap clients.

ns0:criteria.comment: package pam_ldap is not present

ns0:extend_definition.comment: pam_ldap not present or in use

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Logwatch HostLimit Configured
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Test if HostLimit line in logwatch.conf is set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Logwatch SplitHosts Configured
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if SplitHosts line in logwatch.conf is set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: McAfee AntiVirus Definitions Updated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify that McAfee AntiVirus definitions have been updated.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if McAfee AntiVirus definitions have been updated

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing, if using mount.cifs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Require packet signing of clients who mount Samba shares using the mount.cifs program (e.g., those who specify shares in /etc/fstab). To do so, ensure that signing options (either sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i) are used.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

ns0:criterion.comment: Ensure /var/tmp is configured to bind mount to /tmp
Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Zeroconf Networking
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable Zeroconf automatic route assignment in the 169.254.0.0 subnet.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Manually Assign IPv6 Router Address
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Define default gateways for IPv6 traffic

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Support for RPC IPv6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable ipv6 based rpc services

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable Privacy Extensions for IPv6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable privacy extensions for IPv6

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Manually Assign Global IPv6 Address
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Manually configure addresses for IPv6

ns0:criterion.comment: Set static IPv6 address on each interface

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the network sniffer
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the network sniffer

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automout in /etc/fstab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All files should be owned by a user

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: There should not be any shosts.equiv files on the system.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: There should not be any .rhosts or hosts.equiv files on the system.

Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: No .shosts file deployed on the system
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: There should not be any .shosts files on the system.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package dracut-fips should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode

environment variable PATH contains : twice in a row
environment variable PATH contains . twice in a row
environment variable PATH ends with : or .
environment variable PATH doesn't begin with a /

group ownership of all files matches local rpm database
